simple.gui

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.gui.Image

  • public final class Image
extends java.lang.Object
    Object that works as an overhead for the BufferedImage object. Has its own limited functionality, but if you wish to work directly with the BufferedImage, you can get this from the Image object. Ths object's funcionality is currently limited as it's meant to have only simple and easy to understand usage.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Image(java.awt.image.BufferedImage imageToCopy)
      Creates and image with a default filename using the color data from a BufferedImage.
      Image(java.io.File file)
      Creates file from a File object.
      Image(Image imageToCopy)
      Creates an image using the same filename and color data from another image.
      Image(int w_, int h_)
      Creates an empty image with a default filename of the given width and height.
      Image(java.lang.String filename_)
      Creates a new image from a given filename.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g, int x, int y)
      Draws an image to a Graphics2D object with the origin at point x, y on the screen.
      void DrawCentered(java.awt.Graphics2D g, int x, int y)
      Draws an image to a Graphics2D object with the center of the image at point x, y on the screen.
      void DrawRotated(java.awt.Graphics2D g, int x, int y, double angle)
      Draws and image rotated by an angle to a Graphics2D object with the center of the image at point x, y on the screen.

      Returns whether an object equals this Image object.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the image.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the image.

      • getBufferedImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBufferedImage()
        Returns the BufferedImage object from the image.

      • getFileName

        public java.lang.String getFileName()
        Returns the filename of the image. If it is an image created without a filename, then a default filename is used: the String (image width) + "-by-" + (image height).

      • setFileName

        public void setFileName(java.lang.String newFileName)
        Sets the image's filename (name stored in the object, not the actual filename on the computer).

      • resize

        public static Image resize(Image image,
                           int newWidth,
                           int newHeight)
        Returns a copy of an image object resized to new bounds. Scales pixels by deciding which pixel has the best claim (which pixel is closest to the empty pixel upon resize). Does not perform any anti-aliasing. WARNING: If you shrink an image and set that image to it, the old data is permanently lost.
        Parameters:
        image - Image object to resize.
        newWidth - New width to scale image to.
        newHeight - New height to scale image to.

      • resize

        public Image resize(int newWidth,
                    int newHeight)
        Returns a copy of the image resized to new bounds. Scales pixels by deciding which pixel has the best claim (which pixel is closest to the empty pixel upon resize). Does not perform any anti-aliasing. WARNING: If you skrink the image and set this image to it, the old data is permanently lost.
        Parameters:
        newWidth - New width to scale image to.
        newHeight - New height to scale image to.

      • get

        public java.awt.Color get(int x,
                          int y)
        Returns the color data of the image at the pixel (w, h). Note that the point (0, 0) is the origin of the image, not the screen.

      • getPixels

        public java.awt.Color[] getPixels()
        Returns the color data of all the pixels as an array. Returns column first.

      • set

        public void set(int x,
                int y,
                java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the color data of the image at the pixel (w, h). Note that th point (0, 0) is the origin of the image, not the screen.

      • setPixels

        public void setPixels(java.awt.Color[] pixelData)
        Sets all the color data of the image from an aray. Sets column first.

      • Draw

        public void Draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Draws an image to a Graphics2D object with the origin at point x, y on the screen.

      • DrawCentered

        public void DrawCentered(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                         int x,
                         int y)
        Draws an image to a Graphics2D object with the center of the image at point x, y on the screen.

      • DrawRotated

        public void DrawRotated(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        double angle)
        Draws and image rotated by an angle to a Graphics2D object with the center of the image at point x, y on the screen.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Returns whether an object equals this Image object. They must both be Image objects, and their color data must match exactly.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
